revision.text:
{{Infobox school | name = Army Public School and College | logo = [[File:Army Public Schools & Colleges System.svg|150px]] | alt = | caption = Army Public School Auditorium, Peshawar | motto = "I shall rise and shine" | location = Warsak Rd, Peshawar | country = [[Pakistan]] | coordinates = | established = | opened = 1992 | schooltype = | district = | grades = [[Grade 5#Pakistan|5]] to [[Grade 12#Pakistan|12]] | houses = {{color box|Blue}} Unity
{{color box|Orange}} Discipline
{{color box|Red}} Faith
{{color box|Yellow}} Tolerance | principal = | viceprincipal = | pupils = | medium = [[English medium education|English Medium]] | schedule = [[Day school]] | gender = Boys and girls | gender_label = Genders | campus_size = | mascot = | accreditation = [[Secondary School Certificate|SSC]], [[Higher Secondary School Certificate|HSSC]] and [[General Certificate of Education|GCE]] | schoolboard = [[Army Public Schools & Colleges System]] | colors = | feeders = | image = Army Public School Auditorium.jpg | website = {{URL|http://www.apsacssectt.edu.pk/}} }} '''Army Public School and College''' ({{lang-ur|آرمی پبلک سکول اور کالج}}) is an [[English-medium education|English Medium]] school in the [[Pakistan]]i city of [[Peshawar]]. It is one of the 146 school campuses established and managed by the [[Pakistani Army]]'s [[Army Public Schools & Colleges System]]. It was established in 1992, and its student body grew within a two year span after its founding. It became a part of APSACS in 1994.Thornhill, Ted, Imtiaz Hussain, Aamir Iqbal, Aoun Sahi, and David Williams. "[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2875729/Up-20-dead-500-children-teachers-taken-hostage-Taliban-gunmen-storm-military-run-school-Pakistan.html Was Pakistan school massacre in revenge for Malala's Nobel Prize? Children forced to watch their teacher being burned alive as Taliban murder 132 children]." ''[[The Daily Mail]]''. 16 December 2014. Updated 17 December 2014. Retrieved on 20 December 2014. {{stack| [[File:Army Public School.jpg|thumb|250px|Army Public School]] [[File:Army Public School Peshawar.jpg|thumb|250px|Army Public School Auditorium, Peshawar]] }} ==Location== The school is located on Warsak Road in [[Peshawar]]. ==Activities== The school offers sports, debate, and journalism. In 2014 ''[[The Daily Mail]]'' wrote that the extracurricular programmes are popular with students. ==Attack== {{Main|2014 Peshawar school attack}} The school was attacked by [[Taliban]] terrorists on 16 December 2014. The attack killed more than 140 people including about 132 children.{{cite web |url=http://rt.com/news/214707-pakistan-school-hostage-taliban/ |title=141 people, mostly students killed by Taliban in Pakistan army school seizure |work=Russia Today |date=16 December 2014 |accessdate=16 December 2014}} Later on it was announced that the killed students at the APS attack will have their names on more than 120 government schools across [[Islamabad]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{APSACS}} {{2014 Peshawar school massacre}} {{coord|34.0138|N|71.5352|E|source:wikidata|display=title}} [[Category:Schools in Peshawar]] [[Category:1992 establishments in Pakistan]] [[Category:Educational institutions established in 1992]] [[Category:2014 Peshawar school massacre]]
